TopicTitle: "Eve: Order Zero" -- a KSP Graphic Novel (POSTLUDE COMPLETE...bet you didn't see THAT coming.)

Articles.Content: sssshhhh quiet you! I don't know what you mean?

> 
> Yeah, I was not going to promote Kenlie because I like the Kenzin Enlie pun so much, but yeah after carrying this interlude for 16 pages and managing to bring the Gliido down in one piece I can't exactly deny he deserves it. Kenty Loonie, maybe?

I don't know. I kind of like Kooty Lenlie.

And, yes, he does deserve the promotion. Nice move using the launch pad to stop the ship.

Loved Gene's quip.

Wonderful interlude, Kuzzter. I'm very much looking forward to the next chapter.

Thank you.

Happy landings!

> 
> Yeah, I was not going to promote Kenlie because I like the Kenzin Enlie pun so much, but yeah after carrying this interlude for 16 pages and managing to bring the Gliido down in one piece I can't exactly deny he deserves it. Kenty Loonie, maybe?

I'm not sure of how translate what i was feeling while reading Newdun's wise words...

So i will write it in my native language instead. It was simply "*Emocionante!*"

> 
> I'm not sure of how translate what i was feeling while reading Newdun's wise words...
> So i will write it in my native language instead. It was simply "*Emocionante!*"

*Super emocionante, cara!*
Does anyone else think it would be a better idea to assign certain kerbal crews to certain ships?

For heavens sake, the Kerbfleet personnel is not taught to **keep their mouths shut up when the pilot is landing a plane** ? ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif) Geesh, a guy can keep his mind focused when trying to land a plane without any brakes? ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

P.S And Gene, you just don't sledgehammer the fourth wall like that. It is bad sport, especially after being so concerned with the lack of runway just some panels before ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

**Edited <time datetime="2015-09-26T20:16:44Z" title="09/26/2015 08:16  PM" data-short="8 yr">September 26, 2015</time> by r\_rolo1**

> 
> I can totally see this happening to Janny. Need an IVA mod that adds a drawer labeled "Blunt Trauma Weapons".
> Well it might--KER is incorrect, I actually have less than half as much dV as is shown on the display. But I think all I have to do is get an orbit. Between *Martingale, Kranefly, Evestation* and *Alouette* if I can't get everything refueled I should turn in my Powerpoint license.

You know, I could actually make an IVA that has such a drawer. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)
Woo! Star Trek II: The wrath of Khan references! Rep for you!

> 
> I don't know. I kind of like Kooty Lenlie.

Yes, that's much better!

> 
> So i will write it in my native language instead. It was simply "*Emocionante!*"

Obrigado! ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

> 
> For heavens sake, the Kerbfleet personnel is not taught to **keep their mouths shut up when the pilot is landing a plane** ? ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif) Geesh, a guy can keep his mind focused when trying to land a plane without any brakes? ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

Yeah, that's pretty much Kerbfleet for you... I can recall three spaceplane landings so far, and somebody was yelling in every one of them! ETA: A fourth landing, and the exception--Tedus's solo crash of the Dipperkraft.

> 
> You know, I could actually make an IVA that has such a drawer. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

Heh, I know you could! But in fact my Kerbalverse is nonviolent so I wouldn't be able to use it ![:(](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_sad.gif) However, I may beg of you a favor depending on what sorts of cockpits are available in 1.1!

- - - Updated - - -

> 
> Woo! Star Trek II: The wrath of Khan references! Rep for you!

Thanks! Have been wanting to work that one in for a long time. Glad I could do it without someone *actually* dying. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

First: Gene sounded like one of those pesky Lookies ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

Second: Newdun is DA MA...ahhh...KERB! Rock solid...and he wields SPACE ZEN with skill and power.

Third: Kenlie got promoted ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif) Yay!

Four: \*stabs all the Marty\Mary\Stu\Sues in the multiverse with a piece of broken strut\* Die, you abominations!!!

> 
> Heh, I know you could! But in fact my Kerbalverse is nonviolent so I wouldn't be able to use it ![:(](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_sad.gif) However, I may beg of you a favor depending on what sorts of cockpits are available in 1.1!

No begging needed, I take requests. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif) And if you need personal jetpacks for those rumored KSMC kerbals, I've got you covered. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)
A reference I referenced was referenced in a Kuzzter comic. I feel so proud.

That was awesome.

Rep when I can!

Oh man, I started reading both of your stories and just couldn't stop. Amazing work!

I'm not sure if I'm more impressed about your abilities to write a good story or your ability to write what Kenlie wrote ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

Skrew spreading around rep!!!

Forum, y u no let me give kuzzter infinite rep?

- - - Updated - - -

PLAN KAPPA IS SLIGHTLY OVERRATED!!!! ![:mad:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_angry.gif)

> 
> Skrew spreading around rep!!!
> Forum, y u no let me give kuzzter infinite rep?
> 
> - - - Updated - - -
> 
> PLAN KAPPA IS SLIGHTLY OVERRATED!!!! ![:mad:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_angry.gif)

Appreciate the infinirep, but whatever 'rating' Plan Kappa has it deserves every star and more. Parkaboy is an amazing storyteller and a far better graphic designer than me. I've been learning a lot from him since he started posting and if my recent stuff looks at all good, Parkaboy deserves much of the credit.

> Skrew spreading around rep!!!
>  Forum, y u no let me give kuzzter infinite rep?
> 
>  - - - Updated - - -
> 
>  PLAN KAPPA IS SLIGHTLY OVERRATED!!!! ![:mad:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_angry.gif)

I like both kuzzter's series and plan kappa.

Are you mad bro?

> 
> Yeah, that's pretty much Kerbfleet for you... I can recall three spaceplane landings so far, and somebody was yelling in every one of them! ETA: A fourth landing, and the exception--Tedus's solo crash of the Dipperkraft.

So, basically, you're saying that if a Kerbfleet pilot wants a quiet cockpit during a problematic landing, the only way he can do so is to eject the rest of the crew and passangers out? ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif) Those hijacked tourists that are gaining "flight-hours" in their moored plane in KSC 2 should thank the heavens Jeb didn't had issues landing there, I guess ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

Jeb should've sent a contract for an Eve base to Mission Control, that could've been cheaper than lawyers. Remember, Jeb owns a company.

**BTW I wish not to start a flamewar about PK, I was just voicing my opinion** ![:sealed:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_lipssealed.gif)

**Edited <time datetime="2015-10-02T01:59:51Z" title="10/02/2015 01:59  AM" data-short="8 yr">October 2, 2015</time> by Sanic**

> 
> Remember, Jeb owns a company.

That never made sense to me, so in Kerbfleetverse he does not. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif) Maybe the "Jeb's Junkyard" people licensed his name and image for their advertising. Or that is a completely different Jeb.. maybe a "James Ewell Brown Kerman" is the one who really owns the junkyard! 

In other news, following an excellent suggestion I received by PM I updated the OPs both here and on the Duna thread to give the complete Kerbfleet canon for both stories in chronological order. New readers (or re-readers) can now click the links in order and see the pages as the author intended the story to be told. If I got the order wrong or if there are other suggestions, please let me know!
Oh, I forgot to mention- I got the prefix code reference too! ST: TWOK Goodness!

> 
> That never made sense to me

Yeah, I know what you mean. I've sometimes wondered whether Jeb the Kerbonaut has a cousin also named Jeb who runs a junkyard.

Happy landings!

ETA: also not wanting to be impatient, but I really hope you got some good playtime in on the weekend.

> Yeah, that's pretty much Kerbfleet for you... I can recall three spaceplane landings so far, and somebody was yelling in every one of them! ETA: A fourth landing, and the exception--Tedus's solo crash of the Dipperkraft.

To Kerbs, sterile cockpit probably means one recently cleaned of snack debris.

Sterile Cockpit Rule: no snacks on reentry!

**Edited <time datetime="2015-09-29T01:10:16Z" title="09/29/2015 01:10  AM" data-short="8 yr">September 29, 2015</time> by Sanic**

> 
> ...whatever 'rating' Plan Kappa has it deserves every star and more. Parkaboy is an amazing storyteller and a far better graphic designer than me. I've been learning a lot from him since he started posting and if my recent stuff looks at all good, Parkaboy deserves much of the credit.

It's this kind of humble statement that makes this thread such a great read. You even advertised Plan Kappa in your own thread! Thank you displaying for such an uncommon attitude, it's rather refreshing.
